settings.enableAbilityQuickRoll.name: Enable Quick Roll for Abilities
settings.enableAbilityQuickRoll.hint: When clicking on an ability check or saving throw, quick roll to chat instead of using the normal roll dialog. This functionality can be bypassed by holding Alt when clicking.
settings.enableSkillQuickRoll.name: Enable Quick Roll for Skills
settings.enableSkillQuickRoll.hint: When clicking on a skill check, automatically roll to chat instead of using the normal chat output. This functionality can be bypassed by holding Alt when clicking.
settings.enableItemQuickRoll.name: Enable Quick Roll for Items
settings.enableItemQuickRoll.hint: When clicking on an item's image (weapons, spells, features, etc.), automatically roll to chat instead of using the normal chat output. This functionality can be bypassed by holding Alt when clicking.
settings.enableAltQuickRoll.name: Enable Alternate Roll for Items
settings.enableAltQuickRoll.hint: When Alt-clicking on an item's image, output a different quick roll which can be configured separately, replacing the ability to bypass quick rolling for items. This setting has no effect if item quick rolling is disabled.
settings.enableD20Icons.name: Show D20 Rolls for Quick Rolls
settings.enableD20Icons.hint: When outputting a quick roll, display an icon showing the natural die roll next to the total result.
settings.enableDiceSounds.name: Enable Dice Sounds for Quick Rolls
settings.enableDiceSounds.hint: When outputting a quick roll, plays the default system dice-rolling sound.
settings.showSkillAbilities.name: Show Ability Names for Skills
settings.showSkillAbilities.hint: When outputting a skill quick roll, display the name of the ability used next to the skill name.
settings.rollModifierMode.name: Roll Modifier Keys
settings.rollModifierMode.hint: Determines which keys to use to modify quick rolls with advantage or disadvantage. This has no effect if quick rolls are disabled.
settings.defaultRollArt.name: Quick Roll Image Used
settings.defaultRollArt.hint: Determines which art is used by default for ability checks and saving throws for an actor. If this is not available, the other icon will be used instead.
settings.placementRollTitle.name: Show Roll Title Labels
settings.placementRollTitle.hint: Determines if and where a non-damage roll's title, such as "Attack", appears.
settings.placementDamageTitle.name: Show Damage Title Labels
settings.placementDamageTitle.hint: Determines if and where a damage roll's title, such as "Damage", appears.
settings.placementDamageContext.name: Show Damage Context Labels
settings.placementDamageContext.hint: Determines if and where a damage roll's context label appears.
settings.placementDamageType.name: Show Damage Type Labels
settings.placementDamageType.hint: Determines where the damage type label is placed, relative to a damage roll.
settings.contextReplacesTitle.name: Context Replaces Title Label
settings.contextReplacesTitle.hint: If a context label is in the same place as a damage roll's title label, such as "Damage" or "Healing", it will replace it.
settings.contextReplacesDamage.name: Context Replaces Damage Type
settings.contextReplacesDamage.hint: If a context label is in the same place as a damage type label, it will replace it.
settings.hideSaveDC.name: Hide Save DCs
settings.hideSaveDC.hint: Determines if the DC is hidden on save DC buttons for quick rolls.

error.libWrapperMinVersion: This module requires libWrapper version {version} or newer.
error.labelNotInDictionary: {type} '{label}' does not exist. Valid values can be found in {dictionary}.
error.objectNotExpectedType: Data object did not match the expected type. Expected type '{type}'.
error.incorrectRollType: Cannot roll an {function} roll for roll type '{type}'.

warning.emptyDamageField: One or more damage fields on this item are empty! To roll damage, ensure all damage fields are filled.
